SENT.plain: In 70 patients with initial otorhinological infections there were 87 different central nervous system (CNS) complications
Leptomeningitis was the most common CNS complication (43%) and it occurred mainly in the pediatric age group
Lateral sinus thrombosis (LST) was accompanied by other intracranial infections in 80% of the patients
The highest mortality was found in patients with brain abscess (38%) as the initial or concomitant complication
Despite liberal use of antibiotics, CNS complications of otorhinologic infections are still encountered with considerable mortality rates

Modern imaging techniques are of great value in localizing the intracranial disease, but a complete initial otorhinologic examination is needed to rule out an extracranial focus of infection, sometimes with an insidious course
